IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Alberta Bible College ABC is a post-secondary educational institution awarding 4-year degrees 2-year diplomas and 1-year certificates in Christian ministries. Alberta Bible College carries out 100% of its operations within Canada and does 100% of its direct fundraising in Canada. ABC does have relationships with former students who reside in the USA & with some American churches that have sent students to ABC in the past. During 2022 Alberta Bible College did receive donations from donors in the USA. The conversion rate used was July 31 2023 0.7589 [1.3177]. Over 99% of Alberta Bible College funds come from Canadian sources.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Alberta Bible College is a Christian higher education institution that prepares believers for the sake of the kingdom of God in whatever social and cultural context God leads them locally and globally. This involves personal faith formation as well as the professional knowledge and skills required for service and employment in churches and parachurch organizations.
IRS990.Desc: Salaries for Staff: Program Staff is involved in teaching Biblical content theological understanding the history of the Christian faith perspectives on the global cultural settings of Christianity comparative religions and various professional studies designed to help students acquire the skills for serving churches and para churches. They also supervise practicums provide spiritual direction teaching people to pray listen to and seek God and coach and mentor people on what it means to follow Jesus Christ by loving God and loving people the Great Commandment. These salaries accomplish a consistently high placement rate for Alberta Bible College's programs in church and para-church service and employment.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Library Classroom Materials and Textbooks: Alberta Bible College's educational programs and class assignments require research. Besides a library of 33,000 books periodicals archives and other resources such as LCD projectors internet access throughout the building and computers in the library are provided for classroom and student use.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Student Services and Christian Service Program: Students have access to Alberta Bible College's Christian Service Program which gives them field opportunities both local and distant. They have the opportunity to experience a variety of experiences that help them decide the direction they want to go with the education they are receiving. Student Services is working with the students to form a community and more service opportunities as well as opportunities to build their skills in a variety of areas.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The concept behind the Endowment Fund's use is the fund's principal stays intact and the interest from the funds is used to fund operations or capital projects if necessary. If the Endowment Fund is not needed in those areas the Endowment Fund builds. Presently the uses are divided by donor request into three areas: scholarship general endowment and capital projects.

| PartandLinenumber:,Explanation:| Part1Line3,Alberta Bible College admits students of any race color national or ethnic origin to all the rights privileges programs and activities generally accorded or made available to students at Alberta Bible College. Alberta Bible College does not discriminate based on race color or national or ethnic origin in administering its educational policies admission policies scholarship and loan programs athletic or other school-administered programs or hiring faculty or staff. It is a recognized fundamental human right in Canada that there be no discrimination based on race color or national or ethnic origin. It is prohibited in both federal and provincial legislation. Human Rights Commissions federally and in each province vigorously prosecute any alleged discrimination and are subject to severe financial penalties. Moreover we would lose our charitable status and face extremely negative community prejudice and stigma.| Part1Line4,Alberta Bible College admits students of any race color national or ethnic origin to all the rights privileges programs and activities generally accorded or made available to students at Alberta Bible College. Alberta Bible College does not discriminate based on race color or national or ethnic origin in administering its educational policies admission policies scholarship and loan programs athletic or other school-administered programs or hiring faculty or staff. It is a recognized fundamental human right in Canada that there be no discrimination based on race color or national or ethnic origin. It is prohibited in both federal and provincial legislation. Human Rights Commissions federally and in each province vigorously prosecute any alleged discrimination and are subject to severe financial penalties. Moreover we would lose our charitable status and face extremely negative community prejudice and stigma.| Part1Line7,Alberta Bible College admits students of any race color national or ethnic origin to all the rights privileges programs and activities generally accorded or made available to students at Alberta Bible College. Alberta Bible College does not discriminate based on race color or national or ethnic origin in administering its educational policies admission policies scholarship and loan programs athletic or other school-administered programs or hiring faculty or staff. Alberta Bible College has the following statement in its organizing documents for almost twenty years Bylaw XIX page 8: Alberta Bible College shall not discriminate based on race color sex nationality or ethnic origin in this admission or educational policies or programs. Likewise the College will not discriminate in its hiring or dismissal practices or when recruiting or choosing members or volunteers.|

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: classroom instruction field ed personal formation administrative services fundraising scholarships

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: By policy Bylaws the Trustees are the organization's only members thus the governing body.
The Trustees members and supporting churches may nominate persons to replace those leaving the governing body. The serving Trustees members elect incoming members to the governing body membership.
The Trustees members and supporting churches may nominate persons to replace those leaving the governing body. The serving Trustees members elect incoming members to the governing body membership.
The completed form is given to the institution's president to review before submitting it.

The Board of Trustees adopted the Conflict of Interest Policy. As required by the policy the members are asked at each meeting if there is a potentialCOI with any item on the agenda. Should an item arise unexpectedly the members must immediately rise to the point of privilege and inform the Chair. The finance committee is charged with monitoring compliance with the policy. There has never been an allegation of improper conduct by the Board or any of its members.

A. In determining compensation for staff including the CEO President Alberta Bible College has used the Calgary Board of Education salary grid to determine the salaries of its staff. This method has been in place since 1975. Now the basic decision for the Board is to determine what the Cost of Living increase to give each year. The Board and the staff appreciate an industry standard to base salary decisions. B. Alberta Bible College has no key employees by the definition that is used--compensation over $150,000.
